LongPipes

Class Pipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • LongPipes.Pipe
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PipeTypeOne, PipeTypeThree, PipeTypeTwo

    public abstract class Pipe
extends java.lang.Object
    Pipe is the abstract class which has access methods (Getters and Setter) plus an abstract method to calculate the additional cost of a pie Note: as the class is abstract a "Pipe" object cannot be made.
    Since:
    02/12/17

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void calcAddCost()
      ABSTRACT METHOD - overridden in subclasses, calculates the additional cost of a pipe
      double calcBaseCost()
      Calculate the cost of the pipe based on its core attributes: (length, volume, plastic grade and quantity)
      double calculateRadius(double diameter)
      Calculate radius from given diameter (r = d/2)
      double calculateVolume(double length, double radius)
      Calculates the volume of the pipe by calculating the area of the pipe cylinder and the cylinder of the air gap / hole inside the pipe and subtracting them, then multiplying by length (in inches) to get volume constant 0.9 = the radius of the gap inside the pipe as per long-pipes spec

      • metresToInches

        public double metresToInches(double metres)
        Converts passed argument metres to inches and returns inches (1m ~ 39.37")
        Parameters:
        metres - length in metres to be converted
        Returns:
        inches

      • calculateRadius

        public double calculateRadius(double diameter)
        Calculate radius from given diameter (r = d/2)
        Parameters:
        diameter - value to be converted
        Returns:
        converted value radius

      • calculateVolume

        public double calculateVolume(double length,
                              double radius)
        Calculates the volume of the pipe by calculating the area of the pipe cylinder and the cylinder of the air gap / hole inside the pipe and subtracting them, then multiplying by length (in inches) to get volume constant 0.9 = the radius of the gap inside the pipe as per long-pipes spec
        Parameters:
        length - in metres, the length of the pipe
        radius - in inches, the radius of the pipe
        Returns:
        volume in inches cubed

      • calcBaseCost

        public double calcBaseCost()
        Calculate the cost of the pipe based on its core attributes: (length, volume, plastic grade and quantity)
        Returns:
        baseCost of pipe

      • calcAddCost

        public abstract void calcAddCost()
        ABSTRACT METHOD - overridden in subclasses, calculates the additional cost of a pipe
